title: Ant societies' arms race: Gene activity in defenders depends on invading slavemaking ants

title_detail.value: Ant societies' arms race: Gene activity in defenders depends on invading slavemaking ants

summary: Temnothorax americanus is a slavemaking ant found in northeastern America. In a new study, biologists examined the special relationship between the parasites and their host and made an exciting discovery: The ability of the host ants to defend themselves depends crucially on whether the raiding slavemakers come from an area with a successful or less successful parasite population.
